website_summaries.verdict: This band is less bulky than other designs and provides gentle compression that supports and soothes straining abdominal muscles.
pros: Supports baby bump and provides gentle compression in the abdominal area
Helps relieve hip and pelvic pain, as well as other stretching pain
Helps to lessen spinal pressure and correct poor posture
One size fits up to 46 inches
cons: May not fit larger customers or customers in the last weeks of pregnancy

customer_reviews.title: Worth buying for support
customer_reviews.text: I had mixed emotions about this based on how scattered the reviews are. But, it is WORTH BUYING! It is soft, and fits perfectly. Some people said it rides up but if you fit it on properly it wont. It offers amazing support and eased the pain in my back from scoliosis and my belly pulling my spine forward more. It is also not visible at all under clothing. I am only 20 weeks but this will be helpful my entire pregnancy.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer DeGroff

customer_reviews.title: INSTANT RELIEF
customer_reviews.text: I have been experiencing round ligament and pelvic pain since my second trimester. Now entering the third it had become unbearable at times. I was constantly holding the bottom of my tummy for support. I kept researching different belly bands and in a desperate state from a long day of pain without hesitation picked this one because of the reviews. Within minutes I do not feel the need to hold up my belly and my mobility is better than it’s been for a long time! I am almost completely without any pain and I’ve been wearing it for a few hours. I will be wearing this item every day until my baby is here!
customer_reviews.author: Mickey Love

customer_reviews.title: Thin but extremely supportive
customer_reviews.text: Very supportive! Not a super thick and bulky band either, thin enough to go under the clothes and can’t tell so much. Wish I got this earlier in my pregnancy because it helps so much with lower back/hip/round ligament pain!!
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlyn

customer_reviews.title: This is a reasonably priced option for support and relief!
customer_reviews.text: This product provides a good amount of support without being restrictive. Additionally I think it helped with my hip pain since it adds pressure to my hips. I wish the belt was slightly wider to accommodate plus size belly but I appreciate that it was long enough to fit me to begin with. Definitely a well made product and an easy addition to pregnancy to provide that needed support and comfort especially as pregnancy progresses.
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: Helps with Lower back discomfort
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Very comfortable. Not too bulky; unnoticeable under clothes . I like that it’s cool Breathable fabric doesn’t make me hot and sweaty . I’m a anesthesia nurse anesthetist so it really Helps me with my lower back discomfort during Long work hours . I started wearing this at 28 weeks. It makes a positive difference. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: ayme torres

customer_reviews.title: 30 weeks, SPD, OB recommended.
customer_reviews.text: First time mom with SPD (synphysis pubic dysfunction). This was recommended by my OB for the awful pubic/hip pain! So far it's been great for that little extra support. I've been wearing the belly band you use to hold your pants up which is not as helpful as this. Worth a shot if you're like me and pregnancy just wears on your joints!
customer_reviews.author: Brittney

customer_reviews.title: Soft and comfortable!!
customer_reviews.text: I read plenty of reviews before purchasing, and knew I wanted a soft breathable belt for my 3rd pregnancy. I've been suffering from a lot of round ligament and back pain. I was so excited to receive the belt that I ordered 1 day shipping and I'm so glad I did! It was almost instant relief. I plan to wear this every single day over my clothes (or over a tank top). I tried another brand that was more rigid and uncomfortable, so I returned it and went with this one. Best decision ever!
customer_reviews.author: Kimmy

customer_reviews.title: A little too big for small moms.
customer_reviews.text: It is a good value for the money and breathable but I gave it 4 stars overall only because it's too big. I'm 5 months pregnant with a decent belly but even at the tightest setting it moves all around so I do feel like I'm frequently adjusting it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ABSOLUTELY FABULOUS!
customer_reviews.text: Omg would not have made it through my third trimester without this! I’m average height and weight 5’6” and 150ish during my last trimester. Babe wasn’t a big girl either but I’m a nurse on my feet 12+ hours and always felt like she was going to just shoot out my middle by the end of my shift. This belt gave me LOTS of support and eliminates that third trimester waddle! Love Love Love 10 stars 🙌
customer_reviews.author: Carvera906

customer_reviews.title: Great for pregnancy running
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. 21 weeks pregnant and just finished a 5 mile run with the belt on. Definitely helped with the pressure on my bladder. Without the belt, pressure on my bladder made my runs very uncomfortable. I wore outside of my clothing and there was pretty much no shifting and I was easily able to adjust the belt tighter without stopping my run.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: FIBROID WARNING
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT USE THIS PRODUCT IF YOU HAVE PEDUNCULATED FIBROIDS. I was hospitalized after wearing this band for 3 hours with severe fibroid pain. I've never had pain before. It wasn't until wearing this product that they became disturbed and inflamed. As a result I'm on bedrest and in constant pain. Please beware
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Addict

customer_reviews.title: Wish I would’ve ordered this sooner!
customer_reviews.text: 4th pregnancy and I must admit that I regret not getting this belt for the previous pregnancies. One day my back was hurting so very badly and I decided to just order a belt (not believing it would really help). I haven’t had that back pain since! It’s really supportive and even the nurse at my ObGyn stated how supportive and of good quality it is. It works wonders for me for sure! Definitely taking away some of those uncomfortable body aches that comes with pregnancy!
customer_reviews.author: sly

customer_reviews.title: Super helpful
customer_reviews.text: I am pregnant with my 1st child at the (not so) tender age of 39. To say my body is not the same it was 10 or even 5 years ago is an understatement. I bought this belly band to assist with pretty severe hip pain and lower back pain. I was very skeptical that this would make that big of a difference or a difference at all. I am excited to share that it does help!!! WooHoo!!! I try not to leave it on for too long - 2 or 3 hours at a time and I can definitely tell the difference. I would recommend this products to any Momma to be!
customer_reviews.author: Christina Patko

customer_reviews.title: Very supportive!
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t realize how much I actually needed this until I wore it! I am 8 months pregnant and don’t really have lower back pain BUT I felt so much pressure in my uterus. Tired of the super weighing feeing and as soon as I put the belly band on I felt like I was 3-4 months pregnant instead of 8! Give great support, very comfortable and hides well under clothes.
customer_reviews.author: Uvania

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely awesome!
customer_reviews.text: First off, I got this on a Sunday! I ordered Friday and was expecting it Monday and it got delivered a day ahead. Secondly, as soon as i put this on, i immediately felt a difference! My back isn’t hurting anymore and it’s really comfortable. Even sitting down. It’s also really easy to put on yourself. Would recommend this to anyone. The only thing i regret is waiting till i was 35 weeks to purchase this!
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlyn

customer_reviews.title: Game changer
customer_reviews.text: This belt has taken away so much of my pelvic pain! Before I bought it I was hobbling around every day and could barely move because of my ligaments stretching so much and the weight of my baby belly. It started working nearly immediately though, and I have noticed a huge difference throughout my pregnancy. It's also not hot and uncomfortable like I was worried about - I'm able to wear it up against my skin without any discomfort and it's hidden easily under any clothes. This belt has been a total game changer for me and I'm so grateful for it!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver for busy working mom!!!
customer_reviews.text: I used this for my second pregnancy which was a bit tougher than my first. I had a long commute to work and traveled, so the strain on my body was something I could keep up with but not comfortably. Enter this belly band and voila!!! Easier on my back, easier on my belly muscles, hid well under work clothes, increased my stamina... I love this thing!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Soft, lightweight, supportive belly band
customer_reviews.text: Such a soft and comfortable belly band. It's super easy to put on and adjust in size, and has a wide range of length which allows for use throughout an entire pregnancy. It's soft enough that you can wear right against your skin, and not need to worry about putting a shirt underneath. It's light weight but very supportive in holding up the belly. I've never thought a belly band was necessary before, but this band has changed my mind!
customer_reviews.author: Ben Lease

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice lightweight material. It can be adjusted and fits the baby bump perfectly. I like the extra support that it is giving me during the pregnancy. Easy to use and came as described. Any comfort during pregnancy is helpful
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Helped during activity, hated it to sit down
customer_reviews.text: I bought this at the end of my pregnancy. My babe was sitting super low and I felt like my lower abs needed some help. It definitely helped with pain (and waddling) when I was up moving around, but seemed to be more irritating/uncomfortable if I wore it when I was less active. I ended up wearing it more at home because I was running around with my toddler, but found it didn’t help while I was at work and sitting at a desk more. It’s pretty discrete, I wore it to a concert under a tight black dress and leggings and no one could tell. It definitely helped, but it wasn’t something I could wear all the time.
customer_reviews.author: TrumpetGeek

customer_reviews.title: Great help
customer_reviews.text: I am almost 8 months pregnant and kept having ligament pain, so I was recommended this belt. At first, I struggled, thinking I wasn't making it tight enough, but after wearing a few hours, it was GREAT. Helped bring my baby bump up some so now on my bladder and felt relief! It does have breathable fabric for the front but unfortunate for me, I'm running hot natured now so it's a little hard to wear and work out in. If you have some ligament pain or want some relief for low back, this is your best idea!
customer_reviews.author: Tristan Whitehead

customer_reviews.title: Great for third trimester support
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this in the middle of my second trimester but found it didn’t really do much since my belly wasn’t that big yet and I didn’t need the support so I forgot about it for a while. However starting in my third trimester, I started getting some pelvic/round ligament pain in my inner thigh/groin area especially when walking and going up and down stairs. My doctor suggested using a belt like this and I’ve already noticed a big difference. It does dig in to your back a little bit when sitting but it’s great for when you are on your feet.
customer_reviews.author: N H

customer_reviews.title: Not for plus size mommies to be
customer_reviews.text: Not suitable for plus size women. I didn’t gain much belly or weight during pregnancy mainly because I had morning sickness for the whole 9 months and it still was uncomfortable to use or wear. I’m sure this was made for the thin mommies to be also the band is not as thick as shown in pictures
customer_reviews.author: First Time Mommy

customer_reviews.title: Nice band
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after using bao bei belly band for second trimester because that one was getting too tight and starting to restrict my breathing. This band I wear kind of on the lower band of my bump and it really helps! I'm a healthcare provider so I stand much of the day and it feels so much better when I'm wearing this. The only con is that it's hard to velcro precisely myself so I can only wear it over an undershirt otherwise the velcro is very irritating to my skin.
customer_reviews.author: Livia

customer_reviews.title: Helps take the pressure off back
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfect in the beginning for my pain as I stood at work all.day. I later took a fall in pregnancy and had back pain and had to see a chiropractor and this only eased the pain a little. Come.to find out tho after I had a 9.1 lb baby, the fall caused my spine to bed further than need be and I'm in physical therapy to correct it. So I'd say before all that it def helped and made it so I could stand at work longer
customer_reviews.author: Mama bear

customer_reviews.title: Definitely helps with back pain and back support
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I was having issues with back pain and I'm only 20-21 weeks pregnant. It was very easy to put on myself. I was able to feel a difference right away in how it supports my belly and I can only imagine what it'll feel like once my baby bump gets even bigger. I would definitely recommend this for any momma to be that is having any back pain or round ligament pain. It makes a huge difference!
customer_reviews.author: Farrah Tennell

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and relieved pain!
customer_reviews.text: After having an easy breezy second trimester (and a bump on the smaller side for my stage in pregnancy), at 30 1/2 weeks I started experiencing a lot of pain and soreness, along with tightness and pressure, primarily around my pelvis and lower abdomen. Basically everything hurt really badly! This brought me almost immediate relief. I can't compare to other bands because I haven't tried them, but this was inexpensive and it worked - so I'm happy!
customer_reviews.author: AEB

customer_reviews.title: Fit pregnancy holy grail item
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my must-have pregnancy items. I have never been a big long-distance runner, but I highly recommend this product for the mamas who are. I’ve been walking 3-6 miles a day with no discomfort thanks to this belt. It’s a little hot, but it’s worth it to alleviate the aches and pains of pregnancy. I also found it to be a very generous size, which is great for most, but it might be a little long for very petite mamas, even though it wraps and Velcros, no matter the users size.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Not one size fits all
customer_reviews.text: This is not one size fits all. I am just shy of being plus size and barely had two inches of room to spare on the Velcro for expansion at 25 weeks. Will not last the pregnancy. Had to purchase a different belt custom sized.
customer_reviews.author: Val

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver!
customer_reviews.text: I wore this around the house doing housework and yard work. I was pregnant with our 4th child and it's safe to say my body has had it. Before I got this just going up and down the stairs would kill my back and hips. After I got this maternity belt I was able to do more and not go to bed on pain every night. Definitely wish I would have gotten this with my other pregnancies.
customer_reviews.author: Randi

customer_reviews.title: Immediate relief at super affordable price!
customer_reviews.text: Can’t believe I took this long to buy this!! So upset I didn’t find it sooner, but glad I found it finally! I’m 37 weeks pregnant and was having serious pelvic floor pain extending to my inner thigh and leg. I just received it about 2 hrs ago and seriously not exaggerating but I had immediate relief! The more I wear the pain becomes more bearable and even notice that my penguin waddle is less. Hopefully I’ll have less painful sleep tonight. Definitely buy this!
customer_reviews.author: mariela

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful support for baby #6
customer_reviews.text: I'm due with #6 any day now. I broke down and bought this band about halfway through this pregnancy, when my mid-back began feeling achy a lot. It was perhaps my most important pregnancy gadget/gear, and I wonder how I survived previous pregnancies without it! In fact, I plan to hand it off to a pregnant friend the day my baby is born. My only minor frustration with it is I had to yank it up sometimes. But I think that's because my baby dropped into position, and gravity kept trying to take over.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of Six

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for pregnancy pain
customer_reviews.text: Omg this belt is a complete pregnancy life changer. Im 28 weeks and all belly, so things are getting extremely uncomfortable. Even just standing to do dishes kills my back. I put this belt on and the pain relief was INSTANT. I mean, within seconds I felt so much better. I have only worn it over clothes so I can't speak to how comfortable it is underneath clothing. I wish i would have purchased this weeks ago.
customer_reviews.author: Nichole

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit and so comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Got this two days ago and it has really helped with my pregnancy. I am over 7 months and my stomach felt as if it was busting at the seems and so tight. I put this on after it arrived and immediately felt release of pressure and have been wearing it ever since. Life saver! Really easy to use and extremely comfortable. One of my doctors recommended it for the pressure and pain I was feeling in my stomach and lower groin area.
customer_reviews.author: KRC791105

customer_reviews.title: Maybe for early pregnancy but not in last trimester
customer_reviews.text: At the beginning when I needed minimal support this was somewhat helpful. I don’t like that you have to reach behind you to attach the Velcro, however this seems to be the standard for a lot of the maternity belts... which makes no sense since it’s hard enough to maneuver around your belly! It’s uncomfortable when sitting and dig into my bladder and pelvic area and then rolled up once I hit third trimester. It’s not enough support for me. I’m 5’ 1” and weigh about 188lbs. I was 175 when I got pregnant. My waist area (at the angle they suggest measuring) is about 45”-46”. Just for some reference on size.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea F. B

customer_reviews.title: Amaaaazing!
customer_reviews.text: I am 21weeks. My first child and he is growing like a weed! So fast that I ended up in the hospital with contractions and a hernia. He doubled weight and height in 4weeks and my muscles couldn't handle it. Doctors orders were of course take it easy and to buy one of these to help support my muscles and baby boy! I have to admit I LOVE IT!! Wish I found it earlier!!! It will be my staple for the rest of this pregnancy! Thank you!!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah H.

customer_reviews.title: I loved it
customer_reviews.text: This was a survival tool for me. I delivered a 9 lb baby. I had the most excruciating pain in my lower back, until I bought this belt. It was so amazing that I even slept with it. I literally wore it 24 hours, I took it off just for showers, but put it right back on after.
customer_reviews.author: Karla

customer_reviews.title: Not for plus size women
customer_reviews.text: One size fits all... more like one size fits some people. I don’t not recommend this for plus size women. Way too tight
customer_reviews.author: Maryanna Lugo

customer_reviews.title: Life saver for a working mom
customer_reviews.text: This belt was so worth it for me. I walk about a mile to my office and at about month 7, it became very uncomfortable, this belt saved the day. At work, I wore it on and off, it was comfortable to sit while wearing it, but not a long time, I’d take it off every few hours and put on as needed for weight support. It just took a lot of pressure off my lower back, i could adjust it high or low as i needed. For the price it was amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Lamela

customer_reviews.title: Day 1:  No back/hip pain!
customer_reviews.text: So...I just used this for the first time in the office, and I have noticed no back or hip pain like I have previously from sitting in front of a computer all day. I am 5' 3" and 130 lbs (pre-pregnancy) and currently 158 lbs at 25 weeks (with my second child). I would have given it 5 stars, but the edge of the wrap where the Velcro is does slightly dig into my side. I'm not sure if it's the design or if I have it too tight or if the tights/pantyhose I'm wearing today are not protecting my skin enough. Overall, I'm really happy with it. And you can't beat the price!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Didn't alleviate my pain but very good quality/comfort
customer_reviews.text: On doctor's advice I tried a band, and this one was well reviewed. The quality was excellent, and it was pretty comfortable to wear. The velcro part itself was very adjustable and of good quality, and the contouring of the belt fit my belly well both times I tried it on. I had severe sciatic pain in one hip that only yoga seems to alleviate, and this didn't seem to do much for me at all, so I'd just as soon not wear it. But if you've tried everything or have other symptoms a support band might alleviate, I would say this one is great to try. Congratulations on your pregnancy and good luck!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah V

customer_reviews.title: Fits great
customer_reviews.text: So easy to put on myself and fits great. I was a little worried it would be too big after reading reviews of it fitting so many different sizes. But it just wraps around comfortably to fit your size. I find it comfortable when I’m standing up, but not so much when I sit. So it will be great for times when I’m on my feet for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: BLK

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, great price, wears nicely over time
customer_reviews.text: After several washes and daily use, the quality of this band has held up nicely and I’m really pleased with this purchase. The Velcro is a great quality and still stays in place after many uses. Though this doesn’t exactly look fashionable if you wear over clothing, it’s so helpful for belly and back pain during pregnancy. I wish there was a choice for a black color option, but other than that no real complaints since it does exactly what it claims to and is as it is described.
customer_reviews.author: AS

customer_reviews.title: Life saver!
customer_reviews.text: This was a life saver! I already have a bad back and have had horrible round ligament pain. The back pain was significantly better! The round ligament pain was reduced as well! It still hurts, but I feel like I can actually walk around and not be almost in tears.
customer_reviews.author: Shades

customer_reviews.title: GET THIS YESTERDAY!
customer_reviews.text: This is the most amazing purchase I’ve ever made. The past 2 wks (wks 21-22) have been rough. I am only comfortable laying down. The pain in my lower abdomen and even up at my ribs has been pretty severe. This took it away almost instantly. Still some discomfort but not the debilitating pain I was experiencing before. My doctor made a personal recommendation for this product, I’m so glad I listened. EDIT: My wife wrote the above review. I am not pregnant. Not possible for I am a man.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Schutte

customer_reviews.title: A must-have during pregnancy
customer_reviews.text: I was starting to experience some back pain so I purchased this pregnancy support belt, and now I use it every day. It really helps during my long morning walks. It provides the support I need to feel secure and comfortable. It has a lot of stretch and tightens securely, for women of all sizes. (I'm 180 lbs, Third Trimester- Still plenty of room to grow) I also love how when I wear it under clothes you can't notice it! Totally recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ariella

customer_reviews.title: Definitely makes a difference on my back pain
customer_reviews.text: I started getting round ligament pain around my 6-7 month of pregnancy. My doctor recommended I pick up a belly band to help with the pain. Decided to order this one since the reviews were great. I can feel a difference in my back and round ligament pain when I wear this all day vs when I don't. I would 100% recommend! In fact, I recommended it to my friend who is a few weeks behind me in her pregnancy and she said she feels the difference when she wears hers, too!
customer_reviews.author: cm0nilene

customer_reviews.title: Helping me survive pregnancy on my feet
customer_reviews.text: At first it didn’t help because I believe I had the front portion at the right level, but the back portion was too low and too tight on my hips. Once I adjusted the back straps to go up higher on my hips while keeping the front portion low on my belly, I really feel the support. I work 12 hours on my feet. If I take the band off 6 hours into my shift, I could immediately feel my 32 weeks pregnant belly is heavier. This is how I know that this band really does support me.
customer_reviews.author: cp

customer_reviews.title: Belt reduced my pregnancy pain
customer_reviews.text: In my eighth and ninth month of pregnancy, I got hit with severe lower back and abdomen pain due to walking even the shortest distances. I thought I'd try out this belt, and I'm glad I did. It worked wonders to alleviate my pain, especially my lower abdomen/belly pain. My only recommendation is that mom wear some kind of camisole or tank top underneath her belt to make it a more comfortable experience. It's a little itchy when the belt touches your skin all day. I would highly recommend this product for moms with pain similar to mine.
customer_reviews.author: CAM

customer_reviews.title: Must have!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cause I started to feel some discomfort as I entered my 3rd trimester. This band is easy to use is comfortable & it gives the needed support. Whenever I feel like my back is feeling a little discomfort I put it on & soon enough I feel relief. I wear it when I’m cleaning, walking & for other activities. Is a great product def recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: Pamb1288

customer_reviews.title: No support at all
customer_reviews.text: It literally did nothing. I was so excited reading the reviews, since I'm a waitress and 5 1/2 months in, I could really use the back support. I tried wearing It for a day. It honestly didn't do a damn thing. Not for my back and not for the pressure on my pelvis. I tried making it a little tighter but I felt like it was squishing my stomach and my sides, while still providing no support. Im 5'5" and 140 lbs. I also felt like the width was too thin. The only positive thing I'll say is that the material was soft but that's it. Seriously disappointed. Returning today.
customer_reviews.author: Priscilla

customer_reviews.title: Helps alleviate back pain
customer_reviews.text: If you’re pregnant and having sciatic pain I highly recommend this belly band. I was having pain just sitting and this has helped with that, I can sit for longer periods of time now. It comes with instructions and is easy to get on and off for those frequent bathroom trips. It’s not too bulky but you will see the outline of it if you’re wearing workout clothing. I use it throughout the day which includes exercising and it has helped alleviate pressure during my workout. I have a feeling it’ll stretch out as I wear it but that’s expected since I’ll be getting bigger in the next 4 months.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Couldn’t wait to take this thing off at the end of the day...
customer_reviews.text: It was not so bad at 20 weeks when I had round ligament pain, however as I got further in the pregnancy it got warmer (so not really breathable) and it’s support was mostly increased pressure on my bladder when I wore it. I couldn’t wait to take this thing off at the end of the day. The most annoying thing is the Velcro is at the back so it gets harder to adjust as your belly is growing bigger. Kind of wish I just went to a pregnancy store and bought one there - they let you try them on sometimes
customer_reviews.author: Vixen JP

customer_reviews.title: Relief for pelvic & sciatic nerve pain in 3rd trimester
customer_reviews.text: I bought this around 20 weeks pregnant and used it up until the day before I gave birth. By the third trimester I literally could not walk without this belt. It's easy to put on and gives enough support to provide relief for pelvic and sciatic nerve pain. This belt is the perfect balance between being sturdy & supportive, but not unbearably thick and hot. I wish I'd thought to buy this for my first pregnancy!
customer_reviews.author: Lolabd48

customer_reviews.title: Good belt and good support
customer_reviews.text: Bought this cause I'm currently 31 weeks pregnant and gonna have to have 4th c section. It's a good belt but it does like to rise downward toward my legs. Other than that pretty good support and helps alil with back pain. I'm also a plus size women size 20 and it does fit afraid it wasn't gonna.
customer_reviews.author: Chantel Giffin

customer_reviews.title: Saved me!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Saved me during my pregnancy!!!! I’m a hairstylist working 10 hour days on my feet and towards the end of my second trimester my lower back pain started getting extremely painful. This thing literally saved me. I either leave work with no back pain or VERY little. (34 weeks now and still working for me). Adjustable to fit you during the whole pregnancy. I’ll be saving this for my next pregnancies and also got one for a co worker who is newly pregnant.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good!
customer_reviews.text: This gives me some pretty good support but my back still hurts and my ligaments too after wearing this. I knew it wouldn't be a fix-all, but I just expected more support I guess. I do like how lightweight it is and it doesn't make me hot or show too much under clothing. The best use has been at night when I'm tossing and turning. It help avoid the sharp strains by giving support so that's nice. I don't know if any belt will truly relieve my aches and pains so I guess this does as good as anything else, with the added plus of not making me too hot.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't provide pelvic relief
customer_reviews.text: I'm 27 weeks along with my third baby, and I'm having a hell of a time with pelvic and groin pain (SPD). I bought this style specifically at the suggestion of my OBGYN, but unfortunately after a couple of weeks of trying it out I can safely say this hasn't helped my pain at all. I've tried wearing it the suggested way and also much lower around my hips, but neither has offered any relief. The belt itself is comfortable. The material is breathable. And I can see how this would be beneficial to someone with a different kind of pain. Unfortunately this just doesn't do it for me.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I’m 22 weeks and got this for lower back pain. I definitely notice a difference as soon as I put it on and my back immediately starts to feel better! I’m still figuring out how to properly position the belt, but I think it’ll get easier as I get bigger.
customer_reviews.author: T.H.Ratledge

customer_reviews.title: SAVED MY LIFE!!
customer_reviews.text: Ok, well it didn't exactly save my life, after all having a baby not going to die. I had back pain and umbilical hernia. I wore this every time I was walking, sitting its super uncomfortable, boy did it work! I no longer have the constant back pain and can now have clothes drape over me. My bellybutton got to the point that I couldn't even BREATHE on it, shooting pain into my stomach, but now I am back to normal. I can now pick up my 1 year old with no problem and have my husband touch my belly again.
customer_reviews.author: Celia de Campos

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS!
customer_reviews.text: I was so skeptical on this would work, but my back has been in so much pain I figured why not? It is unbelievable. I'm on my feet all day at work, so I have started to wear this during the day and I cannot tell you how much of a difference it makes! I would highly recommend this band!
customer_reviews.author: Kali

customer_reviews.title: Best thing I bought during pregnancy !
customer_reviews.text: I hardly ever write a rave review of anything, but holy cow this product saved my pregnancy!!! I was against buying most pregnancy products, knowing that I would only need them for a few months. But around the third trimester, I was having severe pain, thinking about taking leave from work, and hardly wanted to get out of bed until I finally caved and bought this. Finally I felt like my real self again! A life changer. Can't believe i waited as long as I did. I will be buying this for all my preggo friends in the future!
customer_reviews.author: Nicki

customer_reviews.title: Easy to wear, helped with back pain
customer_reviews.text: This was packaged well with thought and care. The product design looks and feel well made. I like that I can wear it under clothes without it looking obvious. I think there needs to be specific instructions on how to wear it - it should be worn lower, near the hip area. The product was easy to use - I guess it's just common sense to wear it around the area that feels comfortable, but some people might wear it higher or on the middle of the baby bump. This helped ease the pain of small contractions and back pain. I highly recommend this maternity belt.
customer_reviews.author: SeattleRain

customer_reviews.title: Just OK
customer_reviews.text: I didn't like this that much because the velcro part is on the back and you have to stretch and pull one side of the band all the way around while the other hand pulls the other side to meet and then you have to velcro into place. Too loose and there is no support. It is breathable and once size fits all supposedly so that's a plus. Just wish I didn't have to pull my arm muscles to get it on. When it is on right then it pretty much stays put and gives OK support.
customer_reviews.author: jenerationmama

customer_reviews.title: Pregnancy support
customer_reviews.text: Lifesaver !! I am 29 weeks pregnant and my belly is huge . I started having low back pain a few weeks ago while at work. This alleviated my pain almost instantly. I also love that you can’t see it under my clothes! Worth the money . BUY. IT
customer_reviews.author: Randle M.

customer_reviews.title: Helps oblique pressure and round ligament pain from pregnancy
customer_reviews.text: I love how adjustable this belt is and the price point (low to mid $20s at the time of this review). I started getting very uncomfortable abdominal pressure around early third trimester and it was making sleep really difficult. My Dr recommended an affordable belt from Amazon (she wasn't specific... didn't really matter she said) to wear during the day or while doing gentle exercising to help support the added weight and pressure. You don't wear this to sleep, but the support during the day helps to relax the muscles at night. Totally recommend!
customer_reviews.author: skochie

customer_reviews.title: It’s Amazing Bottom Belly Support
customer_reviews.text: Blew my socks off! I totally love this and I Just received it. It instantly took the pressure off my belly and made me feel totally amazing. I been having lots of pressure on my lower belly at 27 weeks pregnant. I stopped working out due to the strain my stomach felt. I also felt like my vagina had lots of pressure. All I did was sit down. Well anyway I put this thing on and instantly was able to do a small work out! I am so impressed I came to write a review 😂. I’m not paid customer or anything just writing this for anyone looking like I was for support.
customer_reviews.author: fresh slate

customer_reviews.title: Must Have for 3rd Baby!
customer_reviews.text: I was having a lot of pelvic pain around week 20 and my doctor recommended a support band to ease the pressure. I purchased this and have worn it the entire pregnancy - it helps with reduce swelling (everywhere) and is comfortable for the most part. It washes easily, I pop it in a laundry bag and let it air dry. It stays in place throughout the day and is relatively easy to conceal with a tank top under a shirt. My only comment is that the Velcro attachment should be smaller than the part of the band it is attaching to - after a day of wear, it can shift and scratch your skin.
customer_reviews.author: C. Madigan

customer_reviews.title: Every mom needs this
customer_reviews.text: When I was pregnant with my 3rd and farther along in my pregnancy, I was in so much pain I could barely walk let alone do much of anything else to the point my OB was ready to prescribe narcotic pain medication. I did not want to take narcotics and was in tears when a nurse suggested that I try this. This was truly 100% a god send. It doesn't solve the issue entirely but it makes it tolerable to walk or to function and run after a busy 3 year old or go to work. This is probably my most recommended pregnancy thing ever
customer_reviews.author: heather

customer_reviews.title: Finally
customer_reviews.text: I have almost a grade 3 spondy and 20 weeks pregnant. I’ve always struggle with back pain and have tried SO MANY braces. They are either too bulky, too uncomfortable or actually make my pain worse. This is a gentle relief that is breathable and gives me the support I need around my low back that allows be to walk without sharp pain. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Chaya Brenan

customer_reviews.title: Love it so far!
customer_reviews.text: So far- this has been so helpful! I’m 26 weeks in my third pregnancy and all of the ailments I normally get much later.. have hit early. This has helped with pelvic pain, sciatic pain (both sides) and hip pain! It’s not gone, but it has made a huge difference!
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Norris

customer_reviews.title: I could tell a huge difference between when I had worn or not worn it for the day
customer_reviews.text: This saved my back and pelvis from about 20-30 weeks of pregnancy. I could tell a huge difference between when I had worn or not worn it for the day. However, the instructions for putting it on were confusing and made it seem like it should be placed backwards. I had to come reference the photo a few times just to be sure I was right. Also, if you wear it with non maternity pants the Velcro can get very very scratchy. I always made sure to wear with maternity pants so I could wear it over the top part. It’s well made, though, and I will definitely be saving it for my next pregnancy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BUY BUY BUY
customer_reviews.text: MADE A HUGE DIFFERENCE! My back doesn’t hurt and my belly doesn’t feel heavy when i wear the belt. Doctor recommended it and it was totally worth the buy! I can tell the difference when I’m wearing it and when I’m not! I can clean the entire house and my back won’t bother me nor do i feel my belly heavy or pressure.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Martinez

customer_reviews.title: A bit too wide for someone with a small frame - didn't end up using it much
customer_reviews.text: I got this at the beginning of my second trimester but frankly do not use it as much as I expected. there were some times during my second trimester where the weight of my belly felt a little uncomfortable and I wore it more. But I can't really wear it sitting down because the material is a bit stiff and it's slightly too wide for my size. I haven't experienced a lot of lower back pain either so maybe I just don't need the support very much. I thought I'd wear it every day like a bra, lol. But, turned out to be unnecessary.
customer_reviews.author: A. T.

customer_reviews.title: Provides some relief from pelvic pain
customer_reviews.text: Bought this at 36 weeks after almost a week into developing significant groin/pelvic girdle pain. I would say it definitely provides moderate relief from the pain but not complete. I didn’t find that it rides up. I wear it under the bump around the pelvis. For the price I would say it is worth it. Not a miracle worker but definitely helps with the pain.
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Good buy!
customer_reviews.text: I got this because a youtube recommended it. I am now in my 3rd trimester and it has really helped me be able to do my normal household chores, without it my back really hurts. It is sort of bulky, so it's not for fashion at all BUT who is really that fashionable in their 3rd trimester anyway? lol I like it and I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Great bump support
customer_reviews.text: This product has been great. I had another maternity belt that has 2 pieces, one for front one for stomach. It is very bulky and always needs adjusting. I found this belt to be more comfortable, lightweight, and easier to put on. You can't really tell I'm wearing a belt with this one vs my old one. Overall very satisfied with this product. It really helps with holding the extra weight from belly bump.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonaddict

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful, and stays cool.
customer_reviews.text: Fits well with plenty of room to continue growing. I was concerned about it feeling hot, but it’s very breathable! Can wear outside in Texas summer without overheating. Relieves a lot of my low back pain when I need to stand for long lengths of time.
customer_reviews.author: J Goodman

customer_reviews.title: it’s alright
customer_reviews.text: this is alright. it takes a while to find the right positioning. took me a few days to really figure out where to place the band to take the pressure off my lower back. definitely not invisible under clothing. maybe a large shirt or sweatshirt, but not any fitting shirt. also extremely uncomfortable if you’re sitting. it dogs in everywhere and feels like it’s suffocating my belly and squishing my baby. it’s soft and made of good quality. not terrible, but not sure how much use i’ll het out of it unfortunately. was really hoping this would relieve my back pain. it helps a little, but not drastically.
customer_reviews.author: EmmaLizzie

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly useful for c-section recovery!
customer_reviews.text: Love this. I bought it to wear during the pregnancy but actually found it most useful in recovery following my unexpected c-section. I went to several pharmacies and stores to find an actual c-section recovery belt and could not find one that was covered by my insurance. So, I returned home and tried out my trusty maternity band and it worked perfectly!! Made me feel comfortable and free to move around without doing any harm to the surgery area. Definitely recommend for c-section moms!
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Better than nothing
customer_reviews.text: I'm a little on the fence with this belt as I have no other belly band to compare it with. If I'm going to be standing for a while, this is helpful for easing pain in pregnant belly. Its not comfortable for sitting so I can't wear it all day when I'm up and down. And I'm too vain to wear it when I have to go out as I feel like its noticeable. So it hasn't gotten much use other than when I'm cooking and cleaning for the past 5 months...due any day now. I have to say, it still fits which I wasnt expecting.
customer_reviews.author: OctopusQueen

customer_reviews.title: High quality materials, great mid-level support
customer_reviews.text: This is a great mid-level of support band for early in pregnancy or for a smaller baby bump. I do like that it has such a smooth front so it doesn't show through my shirts. Only complaint is that you have to really work to get the Velcro to light up on the back so that the scratchy side isn't rubbing your back the whole time. I plan to use it after giving birth to help compress my stomach to help with recovering, but the front has a belly shape so I'm not sure how well it will work for that since it won't apply even pressure across my belly (more pressure at the bottom than at the top).
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: This product really helped me more in earlier pregnancy. The only thing i had againt it was if it was low enough to help much, when i sat down my butt moved it up into my rib cage. Im 5"4' i also used it once i got home after having a c section
customer_reviews.author: Elissa B. Brewer

customer_reviews.title: Helped my back pain/stomach tightness
customer_reviews.text: Started wearing around 18 weeks due to back pain causing stomach tightness. I was unsure if it was really working at first but as I’ve gotten a little bigger I can tell a difference when I don’t wear it. It has definitely helped with the the symptoms I was having from sitting all day long. It does ride up on me, I’m only 21 weeks so it could just be my size but I find myself pulling it down every time I sit. Other than that, I have no complaints and would recommend as it helps my back pain/stomach tightness after a day at work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: LOVED THIS !
customer_reviews.text: I had a lot of back pain and in the end a lot of weight pain, This gave me so much support and helped with the pain that if I did not wear it I would notice the difference. This was a great buy and im so glad I got it when I did.
customer_reviews.author: christine

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: I was getting pain in my pubic bone and spoke to my nurse and she recommended such a belt. Read good reviews here and ordered it. I was not disappointed. It really supports my belly and I have been able to wear and over most of my maternity pants and even under dresses. It supports my belly well and I am able to do more things around the house. The days I dont have the belt on, I have noticed more lower back/ sciatica pain and that travels to my pubic bone in the front making it difficult to walk, sit and get up. So I would highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: FAIZA R

customer_reviews.title: Nice belt
customer_reviews.text: This support belt is awesome. I work 12 hour shifts as a surgical tech and this was a dream come true. When I was running around the OR I thought for sure I would be covered in sweat under this and I wasn't. It actually kept my belly very cool all day. Not noticeable under clothes. Only thing I will say is that if you're overweight at all this might be too tight for you.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Corlieto

customer_reviews.title: Great support! Breathable and not scratchy or bulky at all
customer_reviews.text: Total game changer! With my first prenancy I was hesistent to get a belt or band because I just figured they were all super scratchy and bulky. This one is so light and breathable while still being supportive! I had initially bought a band for workouts but didn’t love the way it slid around. I’m currently 17 weeks and have been wearing it for a week before I reviewed. Even this early it’s amazing, my only regret is not getting one for my previous pregnancy!! This one is great for long walks and my light workouts. I’m not longer super achey in my hips and back afterwards and it’s such a relief. It’s light and doesn’t feel scratchy or bulky.
customer_reviews.author: Kail Rhine

customer_reviews.title: Works wonderful!!!
customer_reviews.text: I initially purchased the KT tape to use for my belly but I developed a rash from the tape so I returned it and purchased this instead. I got this right around 25 weeks pregnant because I get a lot of back pain. This is my 3rd pregnancy and my tummy is really big. I wasn't sure how it will work or how it'll give me support but it did! I can definitely tell the difference between having it on and not wearing it! I would say, if you're having discomfort during your pregnancy, BUY IT!
customer_reviews.author: NotSoChillMom

customer_reviews.title: I don’t know what I would have done without this belly band!!!
customer_reviews.text: This band is my ULTIMATE FAVORITE PREGNANCY PRODUCT!!! I literally use it day and night. I have diastasis recti and this product has been my life saver! I wear it over my belly during the day. It hold my belly in and relieves the pressure of my bellybutton! At night I wear it right under my bust to bind my abdominal muscles together to get relief when I sleep. Not at all how it’s supposed to be worn but it works and I am so thankful!! My doctor recommended a band because I am a teacher which consists of walking/standing all day!
customer_reviews.author: katey

customer_reviews.title: Pain free!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife who is now almost 20 weeks into our pregnancy. Since my wife was 8 weeks pregnant shes been dealing with horrible low back and sciatic nerve pain. Shes never really had back problems. Its been 2 weeks now that shes been wearing this maternity belt & is completely pain free from the back & nerve pain! She said today that on the second day of wearing it she realized the pain was gone! By the way, my wife works in retail (managment) on her feet most of the day & an average of 10 hour work days. She also has had a couple days where she forgot to put it on.This belt is amazing!
customer_reviews.author: jacob

customer_reviews.title: Happy I bought it!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for some support when I was pregnant because I had severe spd and was in a lot of pain. It helped tremendously for hip and pelvic pain. It gave great support and the breathability was fantastic as I am a hot person to begin with. The stretch was good and didn't feel too tight. I loved this so much after I had my baby I gifted this to my sister n law. No complaints from her and she absolutely loves it. I only wish I had found it sooner for support early on in my pregnancy!
customer_reviews.author: Nina

customer_reviews.title: Started experiencing back pain and sciatica
customer_reviews.text: Started experiencing back pain and sciatica around 24 weeks. Horrible pain that started in the lower back and traveled all the way to my neck and would wake me in the middle of the night because the muscles were seizing. It was terrible. Desperately bought this and voila pain is gone. I don’t wear it all the time just when I know I’ll be moving around quite a bit and have not experienced any pain whatsoever. Oh and I’m now 30 weeks so it’s been about 5 pain free weeks with this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had bought it earlier in pregnancy
customer_reviews.text: It’s like having a sports bra for your belly. I can’t image being without this now that I’ve tried it! Significantly helped my pubic bone pain after standing/walking for long stretches of time. I’m 37 weeks and I’ve started sleeping with it for extra support - this belly is so heavy it’s impossible to get comfortable. The band is not made for sitting so I don’t wear it on days when I’m at my desk. But it’s a must for everything else!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Richards

customer_reviews.title: Nice and comfortable belly support band
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy to decided for Azmed Maternity Belt support band. I read the reviews before I choose which one between so many brands in the market and I trusted this was the best for me. I wasn't wrong. This helps me a lot with my back pain and the supports that give each day for my belly is really nice. The material is soft and breathable. I can use it down my clothes is very comfortable and isn't noticeable. I always hand wash the belt before bedtime and it dries fast. I really recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Edson

customer_reviews.title: VERSATILE BELT THAT CAN ALSO BE USED FOR A HERNIA.
customer_reviews.text: My husband is a stroke victim. He has a hernia, and uses a hernia belt to hold in the protrusion. This pregnancy belt is the most comfortable for him. We’ve tried several other belts specifically made for hernias. We cut off the straps that go between his legs. They didn’t do much and were irritating. This pregnancy belt works well if turned around backwards and connected in the front with the Velcro. It seems to stay in place well even through regular daily activities, and holds in the hernia enough so it isn’t painful.
customer_reviews.author: Bead Nut

customer_reviews.title: Kind of large
customer_reviews.text: This is borderline too big for me, I hope it fits better later into the pregnancy but I was hoping to use it sooner. I am 23 weeks with my second baby (so about 6 weeks ahead bump-size wise as I was with my daughter) and wear a size 8, I basically have to have it on as tight as it goes to have any effect. It is very nice quality wise!
customer_reviews.author: JayZee10

customer_reviews.title: I never expected this to work so well!
customer_reviews.text: This maternity belt far exceeded my expectations! As a pregnant nurse who is on her feet all day this has been my best friend! . It relieves my lower abdominal pain, adds significant back support and pain relief. I never expected the relief it also gave to my hips! I would highly recommend this to others for added support.
customer_reviews.author: KL

customer_reviews.title: Good support for extra weight and siatica
customer_reviews.text: I have had pretty bad siatica with my pregnancy (at 28 weeks currently), and been seeing a chiropractor. With that helping, I wanted some extra support for my belly and back, and found the other reviews very helpful! The belt itself does help! When I take it off at the end of my long serving shift, I feel the weight drop from my belly and feel how much the belt has eased some of that! I will say, it is a little itchy if you wear it against your bare skin, but nothing terrible. Will definitely recommend to other expecting Mamas!!
customer_reviews.author: cheryl stoyke

customer_reviews.title: I use it every day
customer_reviews.text: I'm 8 months pregnant and I cannot go a day without this thing! Its so easy to use, very supportive, and helps the heaviness of my uterus so much. If you have lots of tightness, heaviness, Braxton Hicks, irritable uterus, get this thing. It helps a little with back pain, but if that is your main issue, you might want to go with a different belt.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa
